the state or quality of being like; similarity; likeness.

(biol.) an advantageous superficial resemblance to some other species or object i.e. close resemblance, in colour, form or behaviour, of one organism to another or to some object in its environment, as of some insects to the leaves or twigs of plants; mimicry.
to act imitating another; to play a role (as in a play).
to strive to be like or produce something like; to copy; to imitate.
to be like; to resemble with.

to adhere to, follow, keep or abide by (a law, custom, duty, rule, etc.); to observe.
